items.description: Book contians the storeis of Washington and the continental army through the tumultuous year of 1776. It paints a bleak picture of an overmatched rebel army that where not up to the standards. Furthermore, if not for the stoic preserverance of George washington or the courage of some of his inexperienced but promising generals the world history would be quite different.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/How the war was Won
items.title: How the war was Won
items.description: This book systematically cuts through all the bravado and battlefield-centric focus of World War 2 history and focuses on the things that mattered. Manufacturing, logistics, and control over the air-sea theatre. It also provides insight into how the leaders of both the Axis powers as well as the Allies thought and how they argued against themselves, for better or worse.

items.title: Kvitekrist
items.description: This book is about the life of Olav Haraldson, also known as Olav the Holy. This book offers a glimpse into how the Viking Age was. Mostly, it shows the strife and warfare that shaped history and how the impressions of the writers shape the historical narrative.

items.title: Red Famine
items.description: Sometimes a book makes you physically ill just by reading it. This is the case of the Holomodor, where the genocide of the Ukranian people and its perpetrates are described in Red Famine. The worst parts were the denials and the justifications.

items.title: The First World War
items.description: This book is about the history of the great world war. It covers the major strategic themes and goes in-depth on the conflicts outside of the Western front. It is a book that focuses on the war and only the war.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
items.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
items.description: This book examines what constitutes a "scientific revolution". The book goes into detail, with some specific examples covering Copernicus's heliocentric theory of astronomy, Lavoiser´s gas theory and Røntgen´s x-ray theory.  It covers what the background for each was and tries to find some common criteria for a scientific revolution.

items.title: The Triumph of Seeds
items.description: This book is about seeds from trees. How did they evolve? How did they flourish? What causes them to be like they are?

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Washington's Spies. The Story of America's First Spy Ring
items.title: Washington's Spies. The Story of America's First Spy Ring
items.description: This is a book that takes the human stories of living life during the revolutionary war. It shows how America´s first real spy ring was formed and how they used deception, cunning, and wit to deliver intelligence. It also gives insights into the motivations of the people who choose to rebel against the British or to preserve the British empire in the colonies.
